episodeTitle: The Ryugu Palace in Shock! The Kidnapping of Shirahoshi
description: Luffy escorts Shirahoshi out of her tower to the Sea Forest where they encounter Jinbe at Queen Otohime's grave. Meanwhile, Hachi confronts Hody Jones about the New Fish-Man Pirates' destructive plans but is severely wounded by Vander Decken IX. The palace comes under attack as human pirates break in.

events.title: Flashback to Fish-Man District
events.description: The story shifts back several hours to the Fish-Man District where Vander Decken IX is explaining his Mato Mato Curse to gathered humans. This sets up the confrontation between Hachi and the villains.
events.significance: Establishes the timeline and location where the New Fish-Man Pirates are gathering and planning their assault on the palace.

events.title: Hachi Confronts Hody Jones
events.description: Hatchan arrives at the Fish-Man District and confronts Hody Jones, warning him to stop his insanity. Hachi pleads that the Energy Steroids will destroy their bodies and that they should not destroy Fish-Man Island or underestimate King Neptune.
events.significance: Hachi, who previously worked with Arlong, has changed his ways after meeting humans. His confrontation represents the generational conflict between those who seek redemption and those who continue the cycle of hatred.

quotes.text: You should all stop this insanity! The Energy Steroids will only destroy your bodies! You should not destroy Fish-Man Island or underestimate Neptune!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hachi's desperate plea to stop Hody Jones's plans

events.title: Hody Reveals His Superior Planning
events.description: Hody Jones explains to Hachi that there is no stopping their objective. He states that they need Fish-Man Island to destroy the human race and carry out Arlong's will, but reveals that he learned from Arlong's mistakes and planned more carefully, positioning himself as the intelligent leader of their alliance.
events.significance: Establishes Hody as a more calculated villain than Arlong, showing how hatred can evolve across generations. This reveals the depth of the conspiracy against Fish-Man Island.

quotes.text: There is no stopping our objective. We need Fish-Man Island to destroy the human race and carry out Arlong's will. But I learned from Arlong's mistakes.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody explaining his ideology and plans

events.title: Alliance Structure Revealed
events.description: When Hachi demands to know why Hyouzou and Decken are working for Hody despite not working for Arlong, the alliance structure is clarified. Hyouzou states he's only in it for the money, while Decken emphasizes he is Hody's ally, not his subordinate.
events.significance: Clarifies that the villainous alliance is one of convenience rather than loyalty, with each party having their own motivations. This foreshadows potential fractures in their coalition.

quotes.text: I'm only in it for the money.
quotes.speaker: Hyouzou

events.title: Vander Decken Demonstrates Mato Mato Power
events.description: Hody, disgusted by Hachi's pleas, orders Vander Decken IX to attack him. Decken demonstrates his Mato Mato no Mi power by 'marking' Hachi with a touch and then hitting him with a thrown knife. The curse allows any projectile thrown by that hand to lock onto and chase the marked target.
events.significance: First clear demonstration of the Mato Mato no Mi's devastating targeting ability in combat. This power is crucial to understanding the threat Decken poses to Shirahoshi and establishes how the mark works.

events.title: Hachi Wounded by Decken's Arrows
events.description: As Vander Decken throws a barrage of arrows at Hachi, the octopus fish-man runs for his life in the water, desperately trying to escape. Despite his efforts, Hachi is pierced by all of the pursuing arrows and severely wounded.
events.significance: Demonstrates the inescapable nature of Decken's power and leaves Hachi critically injured. This also serves to show the ruthlessness of the villains and raise the stakes of the conflict.

events.title: Sanji and Chopper Find Wounded Hachi
events.description: Sanji and Chopper discover Hachi covered in arrows and severely wounded. Chopper immediately tries to heal him, providing emergency medical treatment to the critically injured fish-man.
events.significance: Brings the Straw Hats into direct awareness of the imminent threat. This moment connects the A-plot (Luffy with Shirahoshi) with the B-plot (the palace assault).

events.title: Hachi Warns of Palace Attack
events.description: Before passing out from his wounds, Hachi manages to warn Sanji and Chopper about the imminent attack on Ryugu Palace. This warning gives the Straw Hats crucial information about Hody Jones's plans.
events.significance: Critical moment that alerts the Straw Hats to the danger facing the Royal Family. Hachi's sacrifice and warning demonstrate his complete redemption from his Arlong Park days.

events.title: Luffy Escorts Shirahoshi from Her Tower
events.description: Luffy leads Shirahoshi out of Hard-Shell Tower inside her shark Megalo while Brook and the Minister of the Right chase after them, shouting for them to stop. This is Shirahoshi's first time leaving the tower in ten years.
events.significance: Shirahoshi's 'kidnapping' is actually her liberation. For the first time in a decade, she leaves the tower where she was imprisoned for her own protection. This represents a major character moment for the timid princess.

events.title: Shirahoshi Reveals Desire to Visit Mother's Grave
events.description: As they travel, Luffy asks Shirahoshi why she wanted to go to the Sea Forest. She reveals it's a graveyard and the place she has most wanted to visit for ten years - to see her mother Queen Otohime's grave.
events.significance: Reveals the emotional motivation behind Shirahoshi's request and provides crucial backstory. This explains why Shirahoshi has been willing to defy orders and shows her deep love for her deceased mother.

quotes.text: It's a graveyard. It's the place I've most wanted to go for ten years.
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Explaining to Luffy why she wanted to visit the Sea Forest

events.title: Brook Discovers Empty Tower
events.description: When Brook and the Minister of the Right reach Hard-Shell Tower, they discover that Shirahoshi is not there. They realize she has truly been taken from the palace.
events.significance: This discovery triggers the palace's realization that Shirahoshi is missing, causing panic about the princess's safety and making the kidnapping appear real to palace officials.

events.title: Human Pirates Attack Palace Officials
events.description: Human pirates suddenly attack Brook and the Minister of the Right, threatening to kill them unless they open the palace gates. This reveals that the palace has been infiltrated.
events.significance: Shows that Hody's plan is already in motion with human pirates (likely controlled or hired) attacking from within. This demonstrates the scope of the conspiracy against the royal family.

events.title: Zoro, Nami, and Usopp Defend the Palace
events.description: Zoro, Nami, and Usopp defend Ryugu Palace against attacking goons. Palace officials praise Zoro's impressive fighting performance, and when Zoro quips about them serving tea instead, he earns praise for his wit as well.
events.significance: Demonstrates that the Straw Hats are protecting the palace even without knowing the full scope of the threat. Shows the crew's loyalty to their hosts.

events.title: Palace Gates Opened for Invaders
events.description: A random fodder character opens the palace gates under duress, allowing Hody Jones and his New Fish-Man Pirates forces to enter Ryugu Palace.
events.significance: This is the culmination of Hody's plan - the palace defenses are breached and the assault can begin in earnest. This sets up the major conflict of the arc.

events.title: Franky Discovers Den in the Sea Forest
events.description: Franky, riding in a taxi, discovers Tom's brother Den in the Sea Forest. Den appears as a shark fish-man working in the graveyard of sunken ships. Though not fully visible, his presence is revealed.
events.significance: Connects to Franky's backstory with Tom and establishes Den as a character who will provide important information about shipbuilding and the Sea Forest.

events.title: First Use of Franky's Post-Timeskip Eyecatcher
events.description: This episode marks the first use of Franky's post-timeskip eyecatcher, showing his new design and updated appearance after the two-year training period.
events.significance: Represents the ongoing introduction of the Straw Hats' new post-timeskip designs and serves as a production milestone for the anime.

events.title: Jinbe at Queen Otohime's Grave
events.description: Jinbe is revealed sitting in front of Queen Otohime's grave in the Sea Forest. He comments on how Otohime's ideals are still alive even after her death, and reflects on the growth of the princes and Shirahoshi still being trapped in the tower ten years after the Queen's assassination.
events.significance: Jinbe's presence at the grave reveals his deep respect for Otohime and sets up his role as a keeper of Fish-Man Island's history. This scene establishes the emotional weight of Otohime's legacy.

quotes.text: Even after her death, no one has forgotten her ideals.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Jinbe reflecting on Queen Otohime's lasting impact

events.title: Luffy and Shirahoshi Arrive at Sea Forest
events.description: Luffy and Shirahoshi finally arrive at the Sea Forest graveyard and encounter Jinbe at Queen Otohime's grave. This is the first time Shirahoshi has been able to visit her mother's resting place in ten years.
events.significance: The emotional climax of the episode - Shirahoshi is finally able to pay respects to her mother after a decade of imprisonment. This meeting of Luffy, Shirahoshi, and Jinbe is crucial for the arc's development.

events.title: Jinbe Explains Shirahoshi's Confinement
events.description: Jinbe explains to Luffy that Shirahoshi's mother Queen Otohime is resting in the grave before them. He reveals that Shirahoshi had a poorly timed encounter with Vander Decken IX's poison ten years ago, right after her mother's death. She could not even attend her mother's funeral and had to stay locked in the tower for her own protection.
events.significance: This revelation explains the tragic circumstances of Shirahoshi's imprisonment - not only did she lose her mother, but she couldn't even mourn properly. This deepens the emotional resonance of the scene and explains the full weight of what Luffy has given her by bringing her here.

quotes.text: She could not even go to her mother's funeral, and she had to stay in the tower.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Explaining the tragic circumstances of Shirahoshi's ten-year imprisonment

quotes.text: You should all stop this insanity! The Energy Steroids will only destroy your bodies!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Confronting Hody Jones at Fish-Man District

quotes.text: There is no stopping our objective. We need Fish-Man Island to destroy the human race and carry out Arlong's will.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones

quotes.text: It's a graveyard. It's the place I've most wanted to go for ten years.
quotes.speaker: Shirahoshi
quotes.context: Explaining to Luffy why she wanted to visit the Sea Forest

quotes.text: Even after her death, no one has forgotten her ideals.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Reflecting on Queen Otohime's legacy at her grave

quotes.text: She could not even go to her mother's funeral, and she had to stay in the tower.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Explaining Shirahoshi's tragic imprisonment to Luffy

themes.description: The episode contrasts Hachi, who has redeemed himself and changed after meeting humans, with Hody Jones and the younger generation who continue and intensify the cycle of hatred. This explores how trauma and prejudice can perpetuate across generations.
themes.symbolism: Hachi represents the possibility of change and redemption, while Hody represents the hardening of hatred when it's taught rather than experienced.

themes.description: Multiple characters make sacrifices for others - Hachi risks his life to warn about the attack, King Neptune kept Shirahoshi imprisoned for a decade to protect her, and Shirahoshi has endured isolation rather than put others at risk.
themes.symbolism: The tower prison represents both protection and isolation, showing how safety can become its own kind of cage.

themes.description: Queen Otohime's ideals live on after her death, influencing Jinbe, Neptune, and potentially the future of Fish-Man Island. The episode explores how the legacies we leave behind can outlast our lives.
themes.symbolism: Otohime's grave in the Sea Forest serves as a physical reminder of her dreams for peace between humans and fish-men.

themes.description: Shirahoshi's 'kidnapping' is actually her choice to experience freedom despite the danger. Luffy helps her break free from her protective imprisonment.
themes.symbolism: Luffy taking Shirahoshi out of her tower represents the One Piece theme of choosing freedom and adventure over safety and confinement.

characterSpotlights.development: Hachi's confrontation with Hody Jones demonstrates his complete redemption from his days with Arlong. He now fights against the very ideology he once supported, willing to sacrifice himself to stop the cycle of hatred.
keyActions: Confronts Hody Jones at Fish-Man District
Warns about the dangers of Energy Steroids
Gets severely wounded by Vander Decken IX
Warns Sanji and Chopper about the palace attack before passing out
quotes: You should all stop this insanity! The Energy Steroids will only destroy your bodies!

characterSpotlights.development: For the first time in ten years, Shirahoshi leaves her tower prison. Despite her fear and timidity, she makes the brave choice to pursue her dream of visiting her mother's grave, showing growth in her character.
keyActions: Leaves Hard-Shell Tower with Luffy inside Megalo
Reveals her desire to visit her mother's grave
Arrives at Queen Otohime's grave for the first time in ten years
quotes: It's a graveyard. It's the place I've most wanted to go for ten years.

characterSpotlights.development: Hody is revealed to be more intelligent and calculating than Arlong, having learned from his predecessor's mistakes. His cunning and ruthlessness are on full display as his plan unfolds.
keyActions: Explains how he improved upon Arlong's methods
Orders Vander Decken to attack Hachi
Successfully infiltrates and breaches Ryugu Palace
quotes: There is no stopping our objective. We need Fish-Man Island to destroy the human race and carry out Arlong's will.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe is revealed as a keeper of Fish-Man Island's history and Queen Otohime's ideals. His presence at her grave and his knowledge of recent events position him as a crucial bridge between the past and present.
keyActions: Sits at Queen Otohime's grave reflecting on her legacy
Encounters Luffy and Shirahoshi at the Sea Forest
Explains the tragic circumstances of Shirahoshi's imprisonment
quotes: Even after her death, no one has forgotten her ideals.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime added an extended scene featuring Franky riding in a taxi, which was not present in the manga.
The episode marks the first use of Franky's post-timeskip eyecatcher, an anime-only production element.
The anime extended the palace defense scene with Zoro, Nami, and Usopp, adding more dialogue and action than the manga showed.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 614 (p. 10) and Chapter 615 (p. 2-17) from the manga.
This episode marks the first appearance of Den, Tom's brother, though he is not fully visible in this episode.
The episode aired on February 5, 2012 in Japan, but was simulcast in the US on February 4, 2012 due to time zone differences.
This is the first use of Franky's post-timeskip eyecatcher in the anime series.
Episode 534 had no ending theme, as ending themes were omitted from the anime starting with episode 279 and were not reinstated until episode 1071 (17 years later).
